page.title: 04FARMING IN WELFORD ON AVON
page.content: {Market gardens}are places where vegetables are grown for sale to the wholesaler, who sells them to the shop keeper. We have only one market garden in our area in Welford. They grow cabbages, leeks, peppers,lettuce and runner beans. They have nineteen acres of land with long rows of crops and large greenhouses. They have mostly lettuce in them, these they buy in at about seven and a half cms.tall. The greenhouses are kept at 65 degs.C but they do open the windows in the summer months.The Welford{pig farm}has roughly 70 sows. They are continually kept in pens until they reach 82kg live weight, when they are taken to the abattoir to be slaughtered. The farmer grows vegetables to feed the pigs but he also sells some, as well as goats milk. The farm is closed to visitors to avoid infecting the pigs.
